items.title: Live: Maduro security team killed in US attack, Venezuelan defence minister says
items.description: Deposed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is in New York awaiting a court appearance as more damage of US strikes in Venezuela is revealed. Follow live.

items.title: Maduro's allies now ruling Venezuela reject US claims they will 'comply'
items.description: The Trump administration insists Venezuela's leaders will now comply with American demands after the extraordinary capture of president Nicolás Maduro — but his allies are resisting US pressure.

items.title: Were the US actions in Venezuela legal under international law?
items.description: International law is created by all states, not just the powerful few. This makes international community reactions to breaches particularly important.

items.title: The Australian dollar is at a critical crossroads. Which way will it go?
items.description: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

items.title: Inflation, interest rates, EVs: What the ABC's business experts are watching in 2026
items.description: What are you watching in 2026 when it comes to the economy or markets? That's the question we put to the ABC's experts.

items.title: Weary Australia eyes Ashes finish line as England senses opportunity
items.description: Only the rain could slow England's progress on day one in Sydney, as a weary Australia reflected its coach's claims the series really ended in Adelaide.

items.title: Damien Martyn awakes from coma in 'some sort of miracle', thanks public
items.description: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn is awake and talking after being in an induced coma for several days.

items.title: 'I could have been where they are': Aussie teen loses friend in Swiss bar fire
items.description: Yaron Lavy, from Melbourne, says he had planned to join friends at the Le Constellation bar on New Year's Eve but stopped to get water — a decision that may have saved his life.

items.title: Man found in car boot tied up, stabbed, burnt and beaten
items.description: The ABC understands a member of the public contacted police after hearing screams for help from the boot of a white car parked off Woodville Road in Sydney's west.

items.title: Death toll rises in Iran as anti-government protests spread
items.description: At least 16 people have been killed in a week of demonstrations fuelled by the rising cost of living.

items.title: National donor conception register would prevent 'potential trauma'
items.description: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

items.title: The hidden injuries linked to memory changes in family violence survivors
items.description: An Australian-first study finds evidence of previously undetected, long-term cognitive changes in women more than six months after they experienced repeated concussions and strangulation during intimate partner violence.

items.title: Tears for Thanasi, grins for Nick as Special Ks make their return
items.description: Thanasi Kokkinakis said he didn't think he'd be able to return to tennis after a 2025 blighted by injury. Instead he's made a winning return alongside doubles partner and all-round showman Nick Kyrgios.

items.title: 'I went ahead alone': Pakistani woman climbed K2 while pregnant
items.description: Pakistani women are hiking some of the world's tallest mountains and glacier trails, claiming a space that has long been out of reach.

items.title: Two drownings in two days along NSW South Coast as man dies at Jervis Bay
items.description: A 20-year-old man speaks of rescuing three people from rough water on his paddleboard, including a 34-year-old man who was declared dead after he was brought onto the beach.

items.title: Experts weigh in on the butter versus margarine debate
items.description: You might have a personal preference for which spread you use at home, but experts say there are health considerations for which one you use.

items.title: Scoring a spot at this cookbook club is like trying to get Taylor Swift tickets
items.description: Each month, strangers and friends meet to share dishes from a chosen cookbook. But Cookbook Club Naarm is more than a foodie feast, it's a reminder of food's power to bring us together.

items.title: Amid a population crisis, this island needs migrants to keep its industry alive
items.description: The Japanese island of Etajima's oyster industry relies almost entirely on foreign workers due to its aging population.

items.title: How you're already relying on AI, even if you think you're not
items.description: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

items.title: Tourists stranded, dozens of roads closed as rain continues in outback Queensland
items.description: Tourists are stranded in towns dotted across north-west Queensland as rain continues to keep major rivers in flood.

items.title: Friends keep teenage pact to retire in the outback together
items.description: Veronica and Wendy made a pact as teenagers to move back to their hometown to retire together. More than 40 years later they have kept their promise.

items.title: Major fire at grain storage facility north of Shepparton
items.description: Fire crews put out a fire that was described as having the potential to cause an explosion early this morning.

items.title: A station and infamous murders: What happened to Sydney's Macdonaldtown?
items.description: It's the suburb in Sydney that no longer exists — except for a train station — but did it disappear because of scandalous murders or was it just to increase property prices?

items.title: 'National crisis': Sports stars call for Bondi federal royal commission
items.description: Ian Thorpe, Jess Fox and Lleyton Hewitt are among more than 60 Australian sports stars joining public calls for a Commonwealth royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Man told to pay $120,000 over unauthorised backyard cheese business
items.description: An Adelaide retiree who continually ignored orders to remove an unauthorised backyard cheesemaking facility from his suburban home is ordered to pay more than $120,000 in costs, after being found guilty of contempt of court.
